articles.title: Maid jailed for putting tranquilliser in breakfast of employer's family
articles.description: SINGAPORE -A maid who feared she was about to be scolded slipped a tranquilliser into the breakfast of her employer's wife and daughter in the hope they would "calm down", a court heard.. Read more at straitstimes.com.

articles.title: China's HNA Group co-chairman Wang Jian dies after fall in France
articles.description: HONG KONG(BLOOMBERG) - HNA Group Co., the once-acquisitive Chinese conglomerate, said that its co-chairman Wang Jian died after an accident on Tuesday (July 3) in France. He was 57.. Read more at straitstimes.com.

articles.title: 9 months' jail for father who assaulted 11-year-old daughter over phone charger
articles.description: SINGAPORE - A 33-year-old man flew into a rage and physically assaulted his 11-year-old biological daughter who, because of a ear infection, had failed to hear him when he told her to pack his phone charger into his bag.. Read more at straitstimes.com.

articles.title: Singapore's economic growth to remain steady in 2018 despite rising trade friction: MAS chief Ravi Menon
articles.description: SINGAPORE - Singapore's economy should continue to expand in 2018 although protectionism risks have risen, said Ravi Menon, Monetary Authority of Singapore managing director.. Read more at straitstimes.com.

articles.title: Blocked in 2009, Horizon Towers goes on collective sale again with $1.1b reserve price
articles.description: SINGAPORE - Back in 2009, Horizon Towers was to be collectively sold for S$500 million but the sale was overturned. Now the prime District 9 condominium has been launched for sale at a reserve price of S$1.1 billion.. Read more at straitstimes.com.

articles.title: Male nurse who posed as doctor to molest patient jailed 7 months
articles.description: A male nurse who impersonated a doctor to molest a patient was sentenced to.... at the State Courts on Wednesday (4 July) after pleading guilty to one charge of using criminal force to outrage the woman's modesty.

articles.title: Passenger trains run on trial from Cambodian capital to Thai border after 45-year hiatus
articles.description: Cambodia's passenger train services ran on trial Wednesday on the 385-km track between Phnom Penh, capital of Cambodia, and Poipet city on the border with Thailand after a 45-year hiatus, Minister of Public Works and Transport Sun Chanthol said.

articles.title: World Cup: England beat Colombia on penalties to reach last eight
articles.description: MOSCOW - England finally ended their penalties curse when they beat Colombia 4-3 in a shootout after drawing their World Cup last-16 clash 1-1 following extra time after the South Americans equalised in the 93rd minute. England had previously lost all three W…

articles.title: IMDA probing 3½-hour Singtel broadband outage
articles.description: Users of the telco were cut off from Web surfing on Wednesday morning. Even payments provider AXS’ website and app could not be accessed due to the breakdown.. Read more at straitstimes.com.

articles.title: ECRL will actually cost Malaysia RM81b, says Guan Eng
articles.description: KUALA LUMPUR: The total cost to build and finance the controversial China-backed East Coast Rail Link (ECRL) project is a whopping RM81 billion, and that has not even included the cost to run it.“The final cost of the ECRL project is actually RM81 billion and…
